intro: Crambe santosii, commonly known as the Brazilian crambe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features small, yellow flowers and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. It is often found in moist, sandy soils in coastal areas. Crambe santosii is valued for its potential in biofuel production due to its high oil content.
